questions.answer_description:
Project quality management is the process through which quality is managed and maintained throughout a project.
Reference:
https://www.globalknowledge.com/us-en/resources/resource-library/articles/what-is-project-quality-management/#gref
questions.question_text: What must be recorded in the quality management approach to meet the minimum requirements for managing quality?

choices.C: The way the project will use product-based planning to plan quality activities
choices.A: The quality management activities planned to take place throughout the project's life
choices.D: The way that quality management will be communicated throughout the project's life
choices.B: The explicit quality criteria for each of the products to be created by the project

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:
A. The quality management activities planned to take place throughout the project's life

Explanation:
The Quality Management Approach in PRINCE2 outlines how quality will be managed throughout the project. To meet the minimum requirements for managing quality, it must define the quality management activities (such as reviews, inspections, and audits) that will occur during the project’s lifecycle. This ensures that all stakeholders are aware of how quality assurance and quality control will be conducted.

Selected Answer: B
The Quality Management Approach in PRINCE2 defines how quality will be managed throughout the project. To meet the minimum requirements for managing quality, it is essential to record the explicit quality criteria for each of the products to be created by the project. This ensures that each product has clear quality standards, which are used to assess whether the product meets the required specifications and satisfies the project's objectives.

A is correct, Why the other options are incorrect:
B. The explicit quality criteria for each of the products to be created by the project
While quality criteria are critical, these are captured in the Product Descriptions rather than the Quality Management Approach. The Quality Management Approach defines the overarching strategy for managing quality, not the specific criteria for individual products.

C. The way the project will use product-based planning to plan quality activities
Product-based planning focuses on identifying and structuring products but does not detail how quality will be managed. The Quality Management Approach is broader and goes beyond just product-based planning.

D. The way that quality management will be communicated throughout the project's life
Communication related to quality is part of the Communication Management Approach, not the Quality Management Approach. The latter focuses on planning and executing quality-related activities.

questions.question_text: Which describes a purpose of the risk management approach?

choices.C: To provide a baseline for monitoring completion of planned risk management activities
choices.A: To define the roles and responsibilities for the specified risk processes
choices.B: To maintain information on identified project threats and opportunities
choices.D: To advise the project board of any potential problems and risks

discussion.content:
B. To maintain information on identified project threats and opportunities
The primary purpose of a risk register in project risk management is to document and track potential project risks, their analysis, and planned responses, ensuring proactive risk management and informed decision-making throughout the project lifecycle.

Selected Answer: A
A. To define the roles and responsibilities for the specified risk processes

Explanation:
The Risk Management Approach outlines the methodology and processes for managing risks within the project. Its primary purpose is to define the roles and responsibilities for managing risks, including how risks will be identified, assessed, and controlled throughout the project. This ensures that everyone involved knows their role in risk management and how risks will be handled.

Selected Answer: A
The purpose of the risk management approach is to set out the processes, roles, responsibilities, and procedures for identifying, assessing, and managing risks throughout the project. It ensures that there is a structured approach to risk management and that everyone involved understands their responsibilities.

A is correct; Why the other options are less accurate:

B. To maintain information on identified project threats and opportunities: This is the purpose of the risk register, not the risk management approach itself.
C. To provide a baseline for monitoring completion of planned risk management activities: While the approach might include some elements of planning, its primary purpose is to define the overall framework and responsibilities.
D. To advise the project board of any potential problems and risks: This is part of the ongoing risk management process, not the sole purpose of the risk management approach.
